Improvements.Improvement: Use a switch statement instead of multiple if-else statements
Improvements.Change_Diff:
- if (sketchType == DOUBLES_SKETCH) { ... } else if (sketchType == FLOATS_SKETCH) { ... } else { ... }
+ switch (sketchType) { case DOUBLES_SKETCH: ... break; case FLOATS_SKETCH: ... break; default: ... break; }
Improvements.Description: Instead of using multiple if-else statements to check the sketch type and execute the respective code, a switch statement can be used. This will make the code more readable and easier to maintain.

Improvements.Improvement: Extract repetitive code into separate methods
Improvements.Change_Diff:
- if (sketchType == DOUBLES_SKETCH) { ... } else if (sketchType == FLOATS_SKETCH) { ... } else { ... }
+ createAndCopyArray(sketchType, myNewTotalItemsCapacity, myCurTotalItemsCapacity);
Improvements.Description: The code that is creating and copying the new arrays is duplicated for each sketch type. This can be extracted into a separate generic method, which can be reused. This will make the code more concise and easier to maintain.

Improvements.Change_Diff:
- final int[] myCurLevelsArr=sketch.getLevelsArray(sketch.sketchStructure); ... final int myNewNumLevels; ... final int[] myNewLevelsArr; ...
+ final int[] currentLevelsArray=sketch.getLevelsArray(sketch.sketchStructure); ... final int newNumLevels; ... final int[] newLevelsArray; ...
Improvements.Description: Several variable names such as 'myCurLevelsArr', 'myCurNumLevels', 'myNewLevelsArr' are not intuitive and can be renamed to more descriptive names. This will make the code more readable and understandable.

Method_Improvements.Final code: static void addEmptyTopLevelToCompletelyFullSketch(final KllSketch sketch){ ... switch (sketchType) { case DOUBLES_SKETCH: ... break; case FLOATS_SKETCH: ... break; default: ... break; } ... createAndCopyArray(sketchType, myNewTotalItemsCapacity, myCurTotalItemsCapacity); ... final int[] currentLevelsArray=sketch.getLevelsArray(sketch.sketchStructure); ... final int newNumLevels; ... final int[] newLevelsArray; ... }
